hello: I'm having problems with my display driver on a fresh installation.
I get a garbled screen on startup.
I'm not sure which version of ubuntu I'm running.
any idea how I can fix this?
I tried a a different combinations of boot options, but nothing seemed to work.
nomemset xforcevesa vga=xxx, etc..
it's "nomodeset". Is that installed on the hard disk?
do you get a grub menu?
it should say the ubuntu version there afaik. And you can use the recovery mode to boot it to cli and further troubleshoot it (e.g. see what vga you have)
Ubuntu 7.04 or 7.10 are too old, you should upgrade. The recovery mode didn't give you a text menu with some options?
well if it doesn't boot at all and you don't have a live CD, there's only little you can do (e.g. pass init=/bin/sh in the kernel params). Better wait for the download to finish.
that's the busybox shell, it's not your real system. You could run "chroot /root" to see the live system from there.
still can't find xorg.conf, but anyway, now that I have a proper shell, is there nothing I can do to fix my display driver?
I don't think it's a display driver problem, since you're not even getting the recovery menu which is before X
then what could it be?!
what graphics card do you have? lspci -nn -k | grep -A 2 VGA
Silicon Integrated Systmes [SiS] 771/671 PCIE VGA Display Adapter
I think your problem is not display related, but I don't know what it could be, too little info and probably isn't worth troubleshooting it since you're installing 10.10 anyway...
FF crashed, and I'm restarting the download. I have limited time to fix this. I have 8.04 on a CD, do you think I should try installing it?
sure you can do that, I think it'll be the fastest way
ok, thanks!
ok, it seems the number in grub was misleading. I tried to cat /etc/issue, and it syas I'm running 10.04.
ah. I'd suggest booting from the hardy cd, chroot'ing into your lucid and doing some apt-get dist-upgrade in case it solves any problems
